question: On which among the following dates, Jallianwala Bagh Massacre took place?
explanation: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre took place on 13 April 1919. The acting Brigadier-General Reginald Harry Dyer ordered his troops of the British Indian Army to fire abruptly into the crowd of unarmed Indian civilians in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar, Punjab. At least 379 people were killed. Rabindranath Tagore gave up his Knighthood in protest against the 1919 Jallianwala bagh Massacre.
